channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: ARCH 2024 Post-Summer Semester Feedback Survey Now Available
item.description: As the Arch semester ends, the Arch leadership team would like to know about your experience this summer, so please take a few minutes to share feedback about the Arch summer semester by completing the survey sent to your email. You have a very important role to play in our efforts to continuously improve the Arch summer semester experience!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Build a Better Budget” Webinar Scheduled for September 10
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - As part of The Off-Campus Commons Financial Series, Student Living and Learning has partnered with Broadview Federal Credit Union to present this webinar to help participants get ready to take control of their finances and their future. Enrollment is limited, so be sure to register to reserve your spot!
item.author: Students

item.title: APO to Host Service Event Featuring Freerice Game and Food!
item.description: Date: Sunday, September 1, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Join the members of Rensselaer’s chapter of the Alpha Phi Omega (APO) national co-ed service fraternity for their first public service event of the semester playing Freerice, eating rice treats, and getting to know current APO members.
item.author: Students

item.title: Welcome Picnic to be Held for New International Students
item.description: Date: Friday, August 30, 2024 5:45 PM - 8:00 PM - International Crossroads Albany will sponsor a welcome picnic for new RPI international students and visiting scholars at the Chapel & Cultural Center, located at 2125 Burdett Avenue in Troy, just a five-minute walk from the RPI Student Union. Please register to attend!
item.author: Students

item.title: Nominations Sought for 2024 Founders Award of Excellence
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 (all day) - The Founders Award Committee is asking for assistance in identifying candidates for Rensselaer’s Founders Award of Excellence, which was established in 1994 to honor students who embody the qualities of creativity, discovery, and leadership, and the values of pride and responsibility at Rensselaer. Nominations should be submitted no later than September 3.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory “Welcome Back” Event to be Held September 3
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM - The Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory invites everyone to its welcome back “Capture the Flag” event in Lally 102, which will teach the basics of hacking and feature fun cybersecurity-themed games. No experience is needed, so come learn cybersecurity and have fun, and enjoy some free snacks!

item.title: Multimedia Services: Slido Polling Tool Now Available
item.description: Multimedia Services would like to inform the Rensselaer community that the Slido polling tool is now available and integrated with the campus’ Webex license.
item.author: Community

item.title: Updated Laboratory Safety Course Available in Percipio
item.description: Environmental Health & Safety (EHS), in collaboration with Human Resources, has updated Rensselaer’s laboratory safety course, which is an important part of Rensselaer’s overall safety program and provides the campus community with resources for conducting laboratory activities in a safe and efficient manner. Students, faculty and staff who work in laboratory and research spaces are required to take Rensselaer’s Laboratory Safety Series, which is now available in Percipio.
item.author: Community

item.title: “in a plenum space” Film Program to Feature Works by Mazú González, Nguyen-Chi
item.description: Date: Thursday, September 5, 2024 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Join EMPAC curator Katherine C.M. Adams for a program featuring two short works by Thuy-Han Nguyen-Chi and a feature-length experimental documentary by Tatiana Mazú González. Each work reflects off-screen realities and experiments with ways sound can take prominence when film is used to search for something the viewer never sees.
item.author: Community

item.title: CMDIS to Host Facilities Open House September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) invites you to their Facilities Open House, which will be followed by a BBQ! Please sign up by September 9 for facility tours to learn about tools, instrumentation capabilities, fabrication and characterization techniques, and much more.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Schedules September 6 Info Session
item.description: Date: Friday, September 6, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and describes how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Office of Strategic Alliances and Translation to Hold “Meet, Greet & Eat!”
item.description: At 4:00PM on Wednesday, September 4 in the CBIS auditorium, please join the Office of Strategic Alliances and Translation for an OSAT Informational, where they will be unveiling new resources and support for faculty and staff with intellectual property, new ventures, and industry collaborations. President Schmidt will be making opening remarks; a reception will follow the event. Please RSVP to Ashley Jones.

item.title: TIAA Holding In-Person Confidential Retirement Counseling September 5
item.description:
Date: Thursday, September 5, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!
